intro: Argostemma montanum var. pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered argostemma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and are clustered in axillary inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
